---
title: "days_on_zillow_texas"
author: "Rachel Landers"
date: "9/22/2019"
output: html_document
---

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(tidyverse)
```
```{r}
days_on_zillow <- readxl::read_excel(here::here("data", "prepped", "days_on_zillow_state.xlsx"))
```
```{r}
summary(days_on_zillow)
```
```{r}
tail(days_on_zillow)
```
```{r}
days_texas <- days_on_zillow %>% 
  subset(RegionName == "texas")
tail(days_texas)
```
```{r}
summary(days_texas)
```

```{r}
ggplot(days_texas, aes(date, days)) +
  geom_line() +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, 
                                   hjust = 0, 
                                   vjust = 0))
```
```{r}
ggplot(days_texas, aes(month, days)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "summary", fun.y = "mean")
```
```{r}
ggplot(days_texas, aes(year, days)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "summary", fun.y = "mean")
```
```{r}
ggplot(days_texas, aes(days)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 200)
```
